questions.subject: Mathematics I
questions.text: Let f : ℝ → ℝ be defined by f(x) = x² - 3x + 6. Find the number of points where f(x) = f⁻¹(x) given x ≥ 1.5.
questions.explanation: Intersection must be on y=x. x²-4x+6=0 has D<0.

questions.subject: Mathematics I
questions.text: If A = {1,2,3} and B = {3,4,5}, find n(A ∪ B).

questions.subject: Mathematics I
questions.text: Which of the following are functions?
questions.explanation: One input must have exactly one output.

questions.subject: Mathematics I
questions.text: Which of the following is the domain of f(x) = log(x-1)?
questions.explanation: Log is defined for positive arguments, so x-1 > 0 => x > 1.

questions.subject: Mathematics I
questions.text: If f(x) = 2x + 1, find f(f(x)).

questions.subject: Statistics II
questions.text: Type I error occurs when:
options: We reject H0 when it is true
We accept H0 when it is true
We reject H0 when it is false
We accept H0 when it is false
questions.explanation: Type I error is a False Positive (Rejecting true Null).

questions.text: If X=5, Y=10. X = X+Y; Y = X-Y; X = X-Y. What is X?
questions.explanation: This is the swap algorithm. X becomes 10.

questions.explanation: However is used to transition between contrasting ideas.

questions.explanation: Standard academic structure places thesis at the end of the introduction.

questions.subject: DBMS
questions.text: Which normal form eliminates partial dependency?
questions.explanation: 2NF eliminates partial dependencies where a non-prime attribute depends on part of a candidate key.

questions.subject: DBMS
questions.text: Consider a relation R(A, B, C) with FDs {A->B, B->C}. How many candidate keys does R have?
questions.explanation: A determines B, B determines C. So A determines {A, B, C}. A is the only candidate key.

questions.subject: Java Programming
questions.text: What is the output of "1" + 2 + 3 in Java?
questions.explanation: String concatenation happens from left to right. "1" + 2 becomes "12", then "12" + 3 becomes "123".

questions.subject: Java Programming
questions.text: Which of the following are valid access modifiers in Java?
questions.explanation: friend is a concept in C++, not Java. Java has public, private, protected, and default (package-private).

questions.subject: PDSA
questions.text: What is the worst-case time complexity of Quick Sort?
questions.explanation: Worst case occurs when the pivot is the smallest or largest element always (sorted array), leading to O(n²).

questions.subject: ML Foundations
questions.text: Which matrix decomposition is used in PCA?
questions.explanation: PCA involves finding the eigenvectors and eigenvalues of the covariance matrix, which is Eigendecomposition (or SVD).

questions.subject: Business Analytics
questions.text: The 3 Vs of Big Data usually refer to?
questions.explanation: The standard 3 Vs definition by Gartner is Volume, Velocity, and Variety.

questions.subject: Intro to Python
questions.text: Which of the following is a White Box Testing technique?
questions.explanation: Statement Coverage requires looking at the internal code structure, making it White Box. Others are Black Box.

questions.text: What does the diamond shape represent in a flowchart?
